head.title: Cuban Defector Kisses the Ground in Miami

hedline.hl1: Cuban Defector Kisses the Ground in Miami

abstract.p: Andy Morales, Cuban baseball player, kisses ground in Miami after his second attempt at defection succeeds (S)

block.p: Andy Morales, a Cuban baseball player whose second attempt to defect to the United States was successful on Tuesday, kissed the ground in Miami today.
''I am happy to be here,'' Mr. Morales said in Spanish in front of the Miami-Dade County Health Department's Refugee Assessment Program office. ''I am just very nervous from the trip.''
Andy Morales, a Cuban baseball player whose second attempt to defect to the United States was successful on Tuesday, kissed the ground in Miami today.
''I am happy to be here,'' Mr. Morales said in Spanish in front of the Miami-Dade County Health Department's Refugee Assessment Program office. ''I am just very nervous from the trip.''
Later in the night, he was released to his father-in-law, Carlos Castillo, who signed a government document promising to be responsible financially for him.
Mr. Morales was given parole status as a refugee.
He gave a brief statement to reporters in Spanish, saying he was grateful to be here but was very tired and would say more at a news conference on Friday.
